item.title: Storing Binary Data
item.description: PostgreSQLâ„¢ provides two distinct ways to store binary data. Binary data can be stored in a table using the data type BYTEA or by using the Large Object feature which stores the binary data in a separate table in a special format and refers to that table by storing a value of type OID in your table. In order to determine which method is appropriate you need to understand the limitations of each method.
